SEARCH
Package com.example.app

Class DatabaseService

java.lang.Object
com.example.app.DatabaseService
public class DatabaseService extends Object
Provides a robust interface for connecting and interacting with a database using JDBC.

This service manages connection lifecycle (connect, reconnect, close) and provides helper methods for executing SQL queries and updates safely.

Environment variables required:
  • DB_URL — the JDBC URL of the database
  • DB_USER — the database username
  • DB_PASSWORD — the database password
Example usage: 
     DatabaseService db = new DatabaseService();
     db.connect();
     ResultSet rs = db.executeQuery("SELECT * FROM employees");
     ...
     db.close();
Since:
2025-10-20
Version:
1.0.1
Author:
Abhinav, Avi, Bhavana, Ethan, Zayna

  • Constructor Details

    • DatabaseService

      public DatabaseService()
      Constructs a new DatabaseService instance.

      Loads database connection parameters from environment variables using Dotenv. The actual connection is established when connect() is called.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect() throws SQLException
      Establishes a database connection if not already connected or if the previous connection has become invalid.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the connection attempt fails

    • executeQuery

      public ResultSet executeQuery(String query) throws SQLException
      Executes a SQL SELECT query and returns the resulting ResultSet.

      The caller is responsible for closing both the ResultSet and its associated Statement.

      Parameters:
      query - the SQL SELECT query to execute
      Returns:
      a ResultSet containing the query results
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • executeUpdate

      public int executeUpdate(String query) throws SQLException
      Executes a SQL statement that modifies the database (INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE).
      Parameters:
      query - the SQL statement to execute
      Returns:
      the number of rows affected by the operation
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • prepareStatement

      public PreparedStatement prepareStatement(String sql) throws SQLException
      Prepares a SQL statement for parameterized execution.
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL string with placeholders for parameters
      Returns:
      a PreparedStatement ready for parameter substitution
      Throws:
      SQLException - if the statement cannot be prepared

    • getConnection

      public Connection getConnection() throws SQLException
      Returns a live database Connection object. Automatically reconnects if the connection is lost.
      Returns:
      an active Connection to the database
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a connection cannot be established

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the current database connection if it is open. Prints a confirmation message upon successful closure.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Checks if the service is currently connected to the database.
      Returns:
      true if a valid connection exists, false otherwise
